pkgmetadata.longdescription: Tree Height Response Calibration for Swedish Forests // A tool that allows users to estimate tree height in the long-term forest experiments in Sweden. It utilizes the multilevel nonlinear mixed-effect height models developed for the forest experiments and consists of four functions for the main species, other conifer species, and other broadleaves. Each function within the system returns a data frame that includes the input data and the estimated heights for any missing values. Ogana et al. (2023) doi:10.1016/j.foreco.2023.120843\n Arias-Rodil et al. (2015) doi:10.1371/JOURNAL.PONE.0143521.
